header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 78 of 2019 (Ganesh Mohan Nikam Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000398­2019

background.text: 1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 30 of 2019 registered with Satara Taluka Police Station.

arguments.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 01.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under Sec. 65(d),83, 86 of Bombay Prohibition Act. Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, applicant is permanent resident of Shendre, Taluka Satara, he is residing there with his whole family, so there is no possibility of his fleeing, applicant is only earning member of his family, he undertakes to abide by the conditions imposed on him while granting the bail.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 01.02.2019.
The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under Sec. 65(d),83, 86 of Bombay Prohibition Act.
Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody.

It is stated that, applicant is permanent resident of Shendre, Taluka Satara, he is residing there with his whole family, so there is no possibility of his fleeing, applicant is only earning member of his family, he undertakes to abide by the conditions imposed on him while granting the bail.

arguments.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, crime is in respect of keeping illegal stock of adulterated Tadi (liquor) for the purpose of selling the same, applicant alongwith other accused persons have manufactured the same. It is contended that, if he is released on bail, there is likelihood of absconding, hence, prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5.

It is contended that, crime is in respect of keeping illegal stock of adulterated Tadi (liquor) for the purpose of selling the same, applicant alongwith other accused persons have manufactured the same.
It is contended that, if he is released on bail, there is likelihood of absconding, hence, prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. He submitted that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the crime, applicant is the only earning member of his family and if he remained in jail, his family will suffer financially, mentally and physically, therefore prayed for bail.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.

He submitted that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the crime, applicant is the only earning member of his family and if he remained in jail, his family will suffer financially, mentally and physically, therefore prayed for bail.

arguments.text: 5) It is submitted on behalf of prosecution that, other accused persons are involved in this crime. This applicant has allowed to use his own house for keeping illegal stock of tadi. If applicant is released on bail, possibility of pressurizing the witnesses cannot be ruled out. Further it is submitted that, accused no.4 is absconding and investigation is still in progress.

argumentSentences.text: 5) It is submitted on behalf of prosecution that, other accused persons are involved in this crime.
This applicant has allowed to use his own house for keeping illegal stock of tadi.
If applicant is released on bail, possibility of pressurizing the witnesses cannot be ruled out.
Further it is submitted that, accused no.4 is absconding and investigation is still in progress.

arguments.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence submissions of both the parties, it is clear that, applicant is in jail since 01.02.2019, hence, no purpose will be served by keeping the applicant in jail. Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence submissions of both the parties, it is clear that, applicant is in jail since 01.02.2019, hence, no purpose will be served by keeping the applicant in jail.
Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 78 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Ganesh Mohan Nikam be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) alongwith one surety of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. e) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :12th February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 78 of 2019 (Ganesh Mohan Nikam Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000398­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by applicant­accused in C.R.No. 30 of 2019 registered with Satara Taluka Police Station. 
---background-ends---
2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 01.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under Sec. 65(d),83, 86 of Bombay Prohibition Act. Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, applicant is permanent resident of Shendre, Taluka Satara, he is residing there with his whole family, so there is no possibility of his fleeing, applicant is only earning member of his family, he undertakes to abide by the conditions imposed on him while granting the bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) The prosecution has filed its say at Exh. 5. It is contended that, crime is in respect of keeping illegal stock of adulterated Tadi (liquor) for the purpose of selling the same, applicant alongwith other accused persons have manufactured the same. It is contended that, if he is released on bail, there is likelihood of absconding, hence, prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. He submitted that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the crime, applicant is the only earning member of his family and if he remained in jail, his family will suffer financially, mentally and physically, therefore prayed for bail. 
---argument-ends---
5) It is submitted on behalf of prosecution that, other accused persons are involved in this crime. This applicant has allowed to use his own house for keeping illegal stock of tadi. If applicant is released on bail, possibility of pressurizing the witnesses cannot be ruled out. Further it is submitted that, accused no.4 is absconding and investigation is still in progress. 
---argument-ends---
5) Considering the nature of offence submissions of both the parties, it is clear that, applicant is in jail since 01.02.2019, hence, no purpose will be served by keeping the applicant in jail. Considering these facts, applicant­accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 78 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused Ganesh Mohan Nikam be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) alongwith one surety of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. e) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :12th February, 2019. Satara
